Abnormality.String: Echo Bubble Evasion & Movement Speed Up
Echo Bubble Defense & Elemental Res Up

Quest.String: A Song of Red and Fire
King of the Sky, Bane of the Land
No Cure for the Common Baggi
A Few Bumps Along the Way
Out of Sight, Out of Mind's Eye
The Good, the Bad, and Lagombi
Now That's What I Call Great!
The Assault of the Scarlet Tengu
Life is Full of Ups and Downs
Scarlet Tengu in the Shrine Ruins
Fungal Flexin' in the Ancient Forest
White Monster for a White Coat
Into the Bowels of the Vale
A Fiery Throne Atop the Forest
Old World Monster in the New World
It Can't See You if You Don't Move
A Crown of Mud and Anger
Up to Your Waist in the Waste
A Cherry Wind upon the Reefs
Bazelgeuse in the Field of Fire
The Winds of Wrath Bite Deep
The Fires of Hell Bite Deep
A Light Upon the River's Gloom
The White Winds of the New World
Showdown: the Muck and the Maul
New World Sky, New World Flower
A Face Nightmares Are Made Of
A Tale of Ice and Fire
The Secret to a Good Slice
Don't be a Jerk with the Jerky
A Roar that Shook the Vale
In the Heat of the Moment
To the Very Ends with You
One Hot Night in the Spire
Master Hunter of the New World
He Taketh It with His Eyes
Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest
Up at the Crack of Dawn
When Blue Dust Surpasses Red Lust
Like a Moth to the Flame
The Hunter and The Blue Empress
The Lord of the Underworld Beckons
A Bunch of Sticks in the Mud
In the Depths of the Forest
I Am Tranquil, I Am Sound
A Roar that Splinters the Sky
The Moon is a Harsh Queen
When the Swift Meets the Roar
A Fish to Whet Your Appetite

String.String: Your account is limited to up to 7 days worth of exported hunts. Become a supporter to see older exported hunts!
Upgrade your account to Tier 2 Supporter to have access to all exported hunts!
Failed to fetch exported hunts. Try again later.
There were no exported hunts available in the period available for your account.

Generic.String: There's a new version of HunterPie available!
Failed to fetch version. Click here to retry.
You have no themes installed. Install a new one or create your own!

Dialog.String: Version v{Latest} is now available. Do you want to update now?
Are you sure you want to delete {Item}?
Are you sure you want to exit HunterPie?

Poogie.String: Username is not valid!
Password is not valid, it must be at least 8 characters long!
Email is not valid!
No account was found with that username and password.
Hmm... That user was not found!
There's already an user with that email or username!
Account must be verified first! Please check your email, including your spam folder to verify the account.
File is not a valid image!
Failed to upload avatar, please try again in a few minutes.
Failed to upload avatar, size was above 3.5 MB.
The password reset code is not valid or has expired.
Whoops... Something went wrong. Try again in a few minutes!
Sign In
Poogie.Description: Attempting to sign in to account...

Poogie.String: Welcome {Username}! You're now logged in.
Account verification will be sent to {Email} shortly. Please make sure to check your inbox and spam folders!
Uploaded new avatar
Looks like you don't have automatic backups enabled. You can enable it in your Account settings.
You have no backups.
An email will be sent to {Email} with the required code to change your account password.
Password has been changed successfully.

Setting.Description: Client configurations
Discord Rich Presence configurations
Overlay configurations
Feature Flag configurations
Abnormality Trays configurations
Debug Widget configurations
Monster Widget configurations
Wirebug Widget configurations
Activities Widget configurations
Damage Meter Widget configurations
Chat Widget configurations
Specialized Tool Widget configurations
Player Hud Widget configurations
Advanced development tools
Insect Glaive Widget configurations
Charge Blade Widget configurations
Longsword Widget configurations
Dual Blades Widget configurations
Switch Axe Widget configurations
Clock Widget configurations
Account settings
Song abnormalities
Consumable abnormalities
Debuffs abnormalities
Orchestra abnormalities
Armor skill abnormalities
Food abnormalities
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically update itself to the latest version.
If enabled, HunterPie will ask permission to self update.
Apply settings globally to all monsters.
Supporter token for getting beta updates.
HunterPie's default localization
Game to be launched, changing this to another game will also change the settings window to display the settings associated to that game.
If enabled, HunterPie will minimize to the system's tray.
If enabled, HunterPie will not open it's main window at all at startup.
If enabled, HunterPie will not prompt you for confirmation on exit.

If enabled, HunterPie will patch the game to enable some functionality (e.g., damage meter during expedition).
If you do not have [Stracker's Loader] and [Performance Booster and Plugin Extender](CRCBypass) mods, this option can crash the game over extended periods of play. Need to restart the game to take effect.
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically close itself when the game is closed.
HunterPie's render framerate, the higher the smoother the animations will be. Lowering this setting should increase performance.
HunterPie's default rendering strategy. Software will use your CPU to render the overlay, Hardware will use your Graphics Card.
If enabled, HunterPie will limit the rendering framerate to the configured limit.
The delay for HunterPie's scanner, setting this to a low number will make HunterPie extremely smooth, however, will use more CPU.
If enabled, HunterPie will allow you to enable Feature Flags for in-development features.
Current theme used by HunterPie. Keep in mind themes can also affect the Widgets style too.
If enabled, HunterPie will display your activity in your Discord status.
If enabled, HunterPie will display your character name and High Rank in your Discord status.
If enabled, HunterPie will display the target monster's health in your Discord status when available.
Hot Key to toggle the overlay on and off.
If enabled, HunterPie will display the overlay. NOTE: This setting does not override the setting to disable individual widgets.
Hot Key to toggle design mode on and off.

Setting.String: Hide Widgets when game is not focused
Setting.Description: If enabled, all Widgets will be automatically hidden when the game is not the foreground window.
If enabled, HunterPie will always initialize this widget. Turn this off if you don't want this widget.
If enabled, HunterPie will always show this widget whenever there's data to be displayed.
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically hide this widget when the HUD is visible (e.g: At the end of quests, inside the camp, talking to NPCs, etc.)
Controls this widget position.
Controls this widget opacity.
Controls this widget linear scale, the higher the value, the bigger the widget will be.
Orientation of the widget.
If enabled, monsters will be displayed in compact mode (only icon, name and crown). HunterPie will automatically switch to default mode once a monster is targeted.
Controls how many columns will be used for the compact mode, if there are more monsters than available columns, the next monsters will be displayed in a new row.
If enabled, HunterPie will only show the monster you have currently set as target.
If enabled, HunterPie will display details of the monster once they're targeted using the preferred method.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the type of monster above their name.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the monster's health bar.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the monster's health text above their health bar.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the monster's stamina under its health bar.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the monster's stamina text under their stamina bar.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the monster's weaknesses under its stamina bar.
Controls the maximum width for the monsters health bar.
Controls the preferred method to target a monster
Controls the minimum width for the monsters health bar. This width will be used to calculate the dynamic size for the bars if that option is enabled.
If enabled, monster parts will be enabled.
Controls how the parts and ailments panels are going to be placed. - Vertical: Ailments will appear on top of the Parts panel. - Horizontal: Ailments and Parts will appear side-by-side.
Controls how many columns should be used to display monster parts.
If enabled, inactive monster parts will be hidden after X seconds.
Delay to be waited to hide a part that became inactive.
If enabled, monster ailments will be enabled.
If enabled, inactive monster ailments will be hidden after X seconds.
Delay to be waited to hide an ailment that became inactive.
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically resize all monster bars depending on how many health bars are visible at the moment.
If enabled, HunterPie will hide unknown parts (the ones labeled as "???").
Configurations for abnormality trays.
If enabled, the abnormalities will be in compact mode, keeping only the icon and timer visible. Turn this off if you want to see their names as well.
Name for this abnormality bar.
Sets the number of columns that will be used to display the abnormalities.
Sets the number of rows that will be used to display the abnormalities.
Selects the sorting algorithm used to sort all abnormalities.
If enabled, HunterPie will patch the game function so it doesn't hide your aim when you disable the Wirebug visual elements in-game.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Argosy's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Material Retrieval's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Ingredients Center's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Training Dojo's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Meowcenaries's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Harvest Box's data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Cohoot's nest data.
If enabled, HunterPie will show Steamwork's data.
If enabled, your name will be highlighted from the other players.
If enabled, everyone's names will be blurred out from the meter.
If enabled, the DPS plot graph will be visible.
If enabled, only you will be shown in the meter, every other party member and NPC will be hidden.
Controls how the smoothness of the plotting lines.
Controls the thickness of the plotting lines.

Determines the strategy that will be used to calculate the damage per second. - Relative to quest: Will use the quest timer - Relative to join: Will use the time when the player joined the party - Relative to first hit: Will use the time when the player hit the monster for the first time

Determines the strategy that will be used to plot the damage in the graph. - Damage per second: DPS will be used for the graph - Total damage: Total damage will be used for the graph - Moving Average DPS: The moving average DPS calculated based on the sampling rate
The color of your player in the damage meter.
The color of the party leader in the damage meter.
The color of the second player in the party in the damage meter.
The color of the third player in the party in the damage meter.
The color of the fourth player in the party in the damage meter.
The color of follower NPCs in the party in the damage meter.
If enabled, HunterPie will display Otomos damage.
If enabled, HunterPie will display each player's DPS.
If enabled, HunterPie will display each player's total damage.
If enabled, HunterPie will plot your average DPS for the last X seconds, at X second intervals (can be customized via Plot sampling rate setting).
Configure the time in seconds that will be used to calculate points for the moving average DPS plot.
If enabled, the graph will slide over time instead of sqeezing to fit, hiding any points older than the specified amount of time (can be customized via Sliding Window size setting).
Configure the total time in seconds the graph should display when Sliding window plot is enabled. Points older than the configured amount of time will be hidden.
If enabled, HunterPie will display the specialized tool timer and cooldown in a minimal and compact way.
If enabled, HunterPie will display the specialized tool widget only in hunting zones.
If enabled, HunterPie will display the moon phases component.
DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
DO NOT ENABLE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
DO NOT CHANGE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
The minimum level for logs to appear in the console.
DO NOT CHANGE IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically backup your game saves and upload them to the cloud.
If enabled, HunterPie will upload the statistics of your hunts.

CallToAction.Description: Have any questions or technical issues? Get assistance from our team and community.
Learn more about HunterPie's features and how to use them.
